intro: Witheringia micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved witheringia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of mostly herbaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Witheringia micrantha is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
